page.title: 02THE PUBS IN CHIPPING WARDEN
page.content: THE FIRST PERSON TO OWN THE ROSE AND CROWN WAS A MR JOHN GUBBINS.A COPY OF THE LICENCE GRANTED ON THE 11th DAY OF OCTOBER 1872 AT THE COST OF 14pounds-11s-10d STILL HANGS IN THE PUB AT THE PRESENT TIME.HE USED TO WRITE A COLUMN FOR THE SUNDAY EXPRESS NEWSPAPER.HIS NIECE,MISS PILGRIM,OWNED THE FOUR COTTAGES NEXT TO THE ROSE AND CROWN,AND ONE COTTAGE IS NOW NAMED AFTER HER.THE NEXT OWNERS WERE MR AND MISS MALLIN,THEY KEPT A GREEN PARROT OUTSIDE THE PUB.THEN IT WAS MR CLEMENTS ND HIS SISTER.MR CLEMENTS GOT MARRIED AND HAD THREE DAUGHTERS DOROTHY,CISSY AND DAISY.WHEN THEIR PARENTS DIED DAISY AND CISSY KEPT THE PUB ON.CISSY DOES STILL HAVE A HOUSE ALMOST NEXT TO THE PUB,BUT SHE TENDS TO STAY AT DOROTHYS HOUSE NOW.DAISY DIED.MR AND MRS TOLLEY TOOK OVER.THEN CAME MR AND MRS PRATLEY, MR AND MRS FALLAND,NOW MR AND MRS PRATT
